snippet: Four weeks after protesting a proposed reorganization that would have resulted in hundreds of layoffs, striking employees of Radio France returned to work Wednesday.
abstract: Most employees of French public broadcaster Radio France are returning to work after four week strike protesting proposed reorganization that would have resulted in hundreds of layoffs; government's appointment of mediator and promise to work with unions prompted strike's end.
lead_paragraph: Four weeks after protesting a proposed reorganization that would have resulted in hundreds of layoffs, striking employees of Radio France returned to work Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Europe; France: Radio Strike Is Ending
